text:
hey everyone welcome to pai's kitchen so today 
i want to share with you a salad dressing recipe

that changed my life yes a bit of an exaggeration 
i know but it really has in a sense that it has

made me eat way more salad than i ever did before 
that's because i was never really a green salad

person i don't really like it but it's such a 
good easy way to add greens to whatever it is

you're having just to have it on the side but i 
struggled to find a dressing that would make it

enjoyable for me that is until i found this 
dressing which some of you might be familiar

with it's the kewpie deep roasted sesame dressing 
and it is so good it makes everything taste good

but for me at least it is hard to find i got to go 
to like a specialty store and it's quite expensive

so i thought you know i'm going to eat a lot 
of this this is going to add up so i wonder

if i can decode it and make something 
that tastes just like this even better

and do it at home on a regular and turns out i 
was able to do it it's super simple and i'm really

excited to share this with you in case some of 
you have a new year resolution to eat more salads

all right let's get started so i'm going to start 
with toasting my sesame seeds i got white sesame

seeds here and i always toast them myself because 
if it's if you buy the pre-roasted one who knows

how long they've been toasted for so i like to do 
it fresh in goes my sesame seeds i'm gonna turn on

the heat medium high high if you've got a regular 
home stove high is totally okay the trick is you

want to keep them moving all the time so that they 
toast evenly you can also do a mix of black and

white sesame seeds but black sesame seeds have 
a slightly different flavor that's more intense

so if you like that you can substitute as well 
you want to toast this darker than you think

we're trying to duplicate deep roasted sesame 
dressing so not blonde roasted light slow

roasted golden roasted you want deep roasted can i 
go a little deeper probably but just to be safe i

think i'm gonna no i wanna i wanna i wanna take 
it a little bit further very very low heat okay

so that's good i'm happy with that i think i've 
got some nice brown toasted i don't want those

to get burned so i'm gonna just stop it right 
here and then transfer them to a plate to cool

and now i've got sesame seeds everywhere very 
nice now if you're making these in advance

you want to keep them in the fridge once 
they're toasted and that will prevent the oil

from the sesame oil in these in the seeds from 
going rancid so definitely this is a fridge item

before we move on i'd like to tell you about 
today's sponsor care of so care of is a monthly

subscription of personalized supplements that 
i started taking this month and love so some

of you know that i have a background in nutrition 
and so i am very picky with my supplements and so

i was very happy to hear that care of only offers 
items that have been backed by scientific research

and they're very transparent with their sourcing 
as well so how it works is this you take an online

quiz and it'll ask you questions about your diet 
your lifestyle your health concerns your goals

and based on that it gives you suggestions on 
what supplements would fit your needs and then

when it comes it comes in these cool little daily 
packs with my name on it so you take one of these

a day no need to mess around with multiple 
bottles and then each one even has a little

fun fact or quote or like a daily challenge which 
makes it kind of fun you kind of look forward to

taking one of these today so let me tell you 
what i have so because i'm breastfeeding based

on my quiz i've got some prenatal multivitamins 
cranberry for urinary tract health some calcium

fish oils good for the heart also good 
for breastfeeding i also added vitamin d

because there's no sunshine in vancouver and these 
packets are made from eco-friendly compostable

film and you can find info on how to compost at 
this link right here so take the quiz using the

link below to see what vitamins and supplements 
kara recommends for you and get 50 of your first

order using my promo code pylin 50. remember 
you don't have to make big resolutions for the

new year even little changes small wins can be 
impactful and a great way to start 2021. okay

super easy i'm gonna do this in my modern 
pencil because i'm thai and we do everything

in our morning pestle so my sesame seeds go 
in and i want to grind these to release the

aroma but i don't want it completely powderized 
because i still want to see some whole seeds

in the dressings so i like the grinding motion 
and if you're going to do this in a coffee grinder

just be mindful not to over grind it 
you just want to do like quick pulses

and not turn it into tahini so just like this 
mostly it's kind of powderized but you got some

whole sesame seeds in there first thing first most 
important is cupi mayo or rather japanese mayo i

should say i guess they do come in other brands so 
this is a japanese mayo that comes in this iconic

packaging and it's like when you buy it it'll be 
like this tube in a plastic bag and it is a mayo

that does taste a little bit different from like 
the traditional western style mayo so it does make

a difference could you do it without it you can 
but it's not going to taste the same just fyi so

that goes in and you can if you want like a richer 
creamier dressing you can add a little bit more

mayo and then some rice vinegar make sure this is 
plain rice vinegar not the seasoned sushi vinegar

and then i've got some soy sauce and i'm using 
japanese soy sauce to stick with theme i have some

see i've got all these things that look just like 
beige liquids and i have no idea which is which

so this is mirin okay mirin so mirin let me 
just um add it first and then i'll show you

mirin is a japanese sweet cooking wine and i just 
want to add a note about choosing mirin if at all

possible you want to find a mirin that doesn't 
have syrup or sugar or like corn syrup added to

it because there's a lot like most of the cheap 
mirin it's just mostly corn syrup and you're not

really adding too much flavor you might as well 
just use sugar in that case but if you find mirin

that contains only rice salt water and koji 
which is the the fungus that that ferments

it into a mirin that would be better it'd be 
more flavorful it's not just going to be like

syrup if you can't find this you can totally 
just skip it you might need just a little bit

more sweetener but it's not a big deal okay 
and then i have some honey so honey is just

my sweetener of choice you can use brown sugar 
the original cupi actually uses brown sugar but

i'm going to use honey my husband was on keto 
for a little while and we use stevia which also

worked if you want to go low sugar and then i've 
got toasted sesame oil to boost the sesame flavor

and then finally just some neutral flavored oil so 
i'm using avocado oil here you can use canola oil

if you're going to use olive oil which you could 
olive oil has a flavor so it's going to affect

how this tastes so if you're gonna go with that i 
would not do extra virgin which has a very strong

flavor maybe just do like a regular olive oil or 
maybe one of those that's mixed olive oil mixed

with canola oil so something that's not too strong 
and that's it and then now oh and a little bit of

white black pepper which is just my own thing 
here you can do white pepper you don't have to

add any pepper at all it's just something that i 
like to add and then it's time for the mini whisk

yay just give that a good whisk and this dressing 
because it's homemade it doesn't have the gums and

things that helps prevent it from splitting so 
after you store it for a while it will separate

so you just need to shake it up right before 
you use it here's the most important part you

want to taste it using a tiny spoon and if this 
is your first time making it i would even go

as far as saying taste it with some vegetables 
like take a salad leaf dip it in see what it

tastes like on vegetables because it can be hard 
to you know know what this means once it goes on

the vegetable once you've made it a few times 
and you kind of know what you're looking for

oh so good okay what we're going to do now i'm 
going to taste on the salad and i'm going to do

a side-by-side comparison between mine and 
the bottle stuff and see what we find out

all right so we're going to do a side-by-side 
comparison so here's my dressing what it looks

like and then let's see what the cubie looks 
like oh it's quite similar it's better emulsified

that's because they add um then then gum in 
it which we didn't so it's going to be more

like a little bit thicker a little bit more 
viscous you can kind of tell okay i'm going

to give it a taste one straight up i think it's 
a little it's even deeper toasted than we have it
we have more sesame seeds in our dressing

which is something we can do at home because 
we don't have to worry too much about cost

but otherwise it's quite similar but but i really 
do feel our homemade one is a richer sesame flavor

oh but it's so close okay i'm gonna try it on a 
salad and we'll go one thing about salad that's

my biggest pet peeve is all these leaves that 
are like long and makes it you know makes the

eating of it not graceful because it's like on 
your cheek everywhere so when i make a salad i

like to just go and look for the long leaves and 
make sure like something like this you know like

how do you gracefully put this in your mouth you 
can't so i like to go and actually take the time

to tear them in yes then how look at this thing 
what am i a rabbit and this recipe doesn't make

very much because i don't like to have dressing 
just sitting in my fridge for too long but you can

scale it up proportionately as many times as you 
want nothing changes just multiply everything and

i do like to eat salad with chopsticks i feel like 
i have better control of all the leaves this way
ah smells so good

oh man a salad that's actually delicious it's 
just sort of the perfect balance of vinegary

salty a little bit sweet and not too creamy this 
is going to be so good on just about any kind of

leaves these salad leaves that you decide to put 
on or again try it as a dink so the recipe as

always will be on hot thai kitchen dot com if you 
make it i definitely want to see a photo you can

tag me at hot thai kitchen on facebook twitter 
and instagram and if you haven't subscribed to

the show make sure you do so you don't miss an 
episode and a special thanks to all of our patreon

supporters who help support the show thank you as 
always for watching and i will see you next time
